content:
I completely understand your motivation for making your own yogurt! Having control over the ingredients and sugar content is a big plus, and it's great that you're taking steps to reduce your sugar intake. Customizing the flavor and texture to your liking is just the cherry on top!

Vanilla extract and cinnamon are great choices for flavorings, and honey or maple syrup can add a touch of sweetness without going overboard. You might also consider trying out other flavorings like lemon zest, nutmeg, or cardamom to give your yogurt a unique twist.

It's awesome that you've been using the pressure cooking function on your Instant Pot to cook grains, beans, and soups. That's definitely one of the most convenient and time-saving features of the appliance! Brownning meat and vegetables before pressure cooking is a great way to add depth of flavor to your dishes, and I'm sure you'll find the slow cooking function to be just as useful when you start experimenting with it.

If you're looking for some slow cooking inspiration, I'd be happy to provide some recipe ideas or tips. Slow cooking is perfect for tenderizing tougher cuts of meat, cooking legumes, and making hearty stews and soups. You can also use it to make delicious desserts like risottos or custards!

What do you think about experimenting with different types of milk or non-dairy alternatives for your yogurt? Have you considered trying out almond milk, soy milk, or coconut milk, for example?
